Package org.neo4j.io.fs

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.io.fs.FileUtils
  • public final class FileUtils
extends Object
    Set of utility methods to work with Path using the default file system. This class is used by DefaultFileSystemAbstraction and its methods should not take FileSystemAbstraction as a parameter. Consider using FileSystemUtils when a helper method needs to work with different file systems.
    See Also:
    FileSystemUtils

      • delete

        public static void delete​(Path path)
                   throws IOException
        For the lazy people out there that don't know if they are working on a file or a directory. If the path points to a directory that will be deleted recursively.
        Parameters:
        path - a file or a directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

        Parameters:

      • moveFile

        public static void moveFile​(Path toMove,
                            Path target)
                     throws IOException
        Utility method that moves a file from its current location to the new target location. If rename fails (for example if the target is another disk) a copy/delete will be performed instead.
        Parameters:
        toMove - The file to move.
        target - Target directory to move to.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs.

      • moveFileToDirectory

        public static Path moveFileToDirectory​(Path toMove,
                                       Path targetDirectory)
                                throws IOException
        Utility method that moves a file from its current location to the provided target directory. If rename fails (for example if the target is another disk) a copy/delete will be performed instead.
        Parameters:
        toMove - The File object to move.
        targetDirectory - the destination directory
        Returns:
        the new file, null iff the move was unsuccessful
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs.

        public static void copyFileToDirectory​(Path file,
                                       Path targetDirectory)
                                throws IOException
        Utility method that copy a file from its current location to the provided target directory.
        Parameters:
        file - file that needs to be copied.
        targetDirectory - the destination directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs.

      • highIODevice

        public static boolean highIODevice​(Path pathOnDevice)
        Attempts to discern if the given path is mounted on a device that can likely sustain a very high IO throughput.

        A high IO device is expected to have negligible seek time, if any, and be able to service multiple IO requests in parallel.

        Parameters:
        pathOnDevice - Any path, hypothetical or real, that once fully resolved, would exist on a storage device that either supports high IO, or not.
        Returns:
        Our best-effort estimate for whether or not this device supports a high IO workload.

      • rotationalPathFor

        private static Path rotationalPathFor​(Path deviceName)

        private static int readFirstCharacter​(Path file)
                               throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • pathToFileAfterMove

        public static Path pathToFileAfterMove​(Path fromDir,
                                       Path toDir,
                                       Path fileToMove)
        Resolve toDir against fileToMove relativized against fromDir, resulting in a path denoting the location of fileToMove after being moved fromDir toDir.

        NOTE: This that this does not perform the move, it only calculates the new file name.

        Throws IllegalArgumentException is fileToMove is not a sub path to fromDir.

        Parameters:
        fromDir - Path denoting current parent directory for fileToMove
        toDir - Path denoting location for fileToMove after move
        fileToMove - Path denoting current location for fileToMove
        Returns:
        Path denoting new abstract path for file after move.

      • countFilesInDirectoryPath

        public static long countFilesInDirectoryPath​(Path dir)
                                      throws IOException
        Count the number of files and directories, contained in the given Path, which must be a directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory whose contents to count.
        Returns:
        The number of files and directories in the given directory.
        Throws:
        NotDirectoryException - If the given Path is not a directory. This exception is an optionally specific exception. IOException might be thrown instead.
        IOException - If the given directory could not be opened for some reason.

      • windowsSafeIOOperation

                                   throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getCanonicalFile

        public static Path getCanonicalFile​(Path file)
        Canonical file resolution on windows does not resolve links. Real paths on windows can be resolved only using Path.toRealPath(LinkOption...), but file should exist in that case. We will try to do as much as possible and will try to use Path.toRealPath(LinkOption...) when file exist and will fallback to only use Path.normalize() if file does not exist. see JDK-8003887 for details
        Parameters:
        file - - file to resolve canonical representation
        Returns:
        canonical file representation.

      • getFileStoreType

        public static String getFileStoreType​(Path path)
        Get type of file store where provided file is located.
        Parameters:
        path - file to get file store type for.
        Returns:
        name of file store or "Unknown file store type: " + exception message, in case if exception occur during file store type retrieval.

                                throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • listPaths

        public static Path[] listPaths​(Path dir)
        List Paths in a directory the same way as File.listFiles() where IOExceptions are ignored.
        Parameters:
        dir - path to the directory to list files in.
        Returns:
        an array of paths. The array will be empty if the directory is empty. Returns null if the directory does not denote an actual directory, or if an I/O error occurs.
